description: The '''Nashville sound''' is a subgenre of American [[country music]] that originated in the 1950s in [[Nashville, Tennessee]]. It replaced the dominance of the rough [[Honky tonk|honky tonk music]] with "smooth strings and choruses", "sophisticated background vocals" and "smooth tempos" associated with [[traditional pop]]. It was an attempt "to revive country sales, which had been devastated by the rise of [[Rock and roll|rock 'n' roll]]".
